section.title: Annotate Bean class with @javax.ejb.Stateless

listitem.para: Other types include @Stateful, @Singleton, and @MessageDriven
Defines business remote interface for EJB
Alternately can define @Remote(Interface.class) within EJB bean class

section.title: Optionally Annotate Empty Interface Extending POJO Business Interface

listitem.para: Useful when EJB implements legacy interface
EJB must then implement Remote or declare @Remote
EJB artifact looks very much like a normal POJO archive
Since our EJB is 100% annotation-based, we have no need for META-INF/ejb-jar.xml descriptor

section.title: Maven Aspects: EJB

listitem.para: Required in order for downstream containers to recognize as EJB component
Supplies EJB API definitions
Builds EJB and optional ejbclient artifact

section.programlisting:
<project> ... <packaging>ejb</packaging>
<dependencies> ... <dependency> <groupId>javax.ejb</groupId> <artifactId>javax.ejb-api</artifactId> <scope>provided</scope> </dependency> ... </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <!-- tell EJB plugin to create a client-jar --> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-ejb-plugin</artifactId> <configuration> <generateClient>true</generateClient> <clientExcludes> <clientExclude>**/ejb/*Local.class</clientExclude> <clientExclude>**/ejb/*EJB.class</clientExclude> </clientExcludes> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </build> </project>
